thread.title: Las Vegas 51s to open 2016 season April 7 against Fresno Grizzlies
thread.title_full: Las Vegas 51s to open 2016 season April 7 against Fresno Grizzlies

title: Las Vegas 51s to open 2016 season April 7 against Fresno Grizzlies
text:
Las Vegas 51s to open 2016 season April 7 against Fresno Grizzlies Las Vegas 51s to open 2016 season April 7 against Fresno Grizzlies 
A general view of Cashman Field in Las Vegas before the start of a Triple-A minor league baseball game between the Las Vegas 51s and Oklahoma City Dodgers Sunday May 24, 2015. Oklahoma City defeated Las Vegas 2-0.(Josh Holmberg/Las Vegas Review Journal) By Bill BradleyLas   
The Las Vegas 51s will open the Pacific Coast League season April 7 against the Triple-A champion Fresno Grizzlies at Cashman Field, the team announced Monday. 
The 51s, who are the Triple-A affiliate of the National League champion New York Mets, released their complete schedule, which will begin the season with an eight-game homestand, playing the Grizzles on April 7-10. The Sacramento River Cats, who are the San Francisco Giants' top minor-league team, will follow the Grizzlies on April 11-14. 
The Reno Aces, the Arizona Diamondbacks' top affiliate, make two visits two Cashman Field (June 13-16 and July 22-25). However, the Los Angeles Dodgers' top affiliate, the Oklahoma City Dodgers, do not come to Las Vegas this season. 
The rest of the home schedule, which is the franchise's 29 th in Las Vegas, includes nine 12:05 p.m. starts and two 5:05 p.m. doubleheaders (July 8 and Aug. 25). The rest of the home games are scheduled to begin at 7:05 p.m. 
The 51s drew an announced attendance of 333,520 fans in 69 dates last season, averaging 4,834. Last season's opener against Fresno was the first of four announced sellouts (11,007). 
For season ticket information, contact the 51s at 702-798-7872 or at LV51.com. Individual season tickets go on sale in March, the team said.
